member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.FileService.TryGetPersistentRemotePath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check if can be expressed as persistent vsls path. Check if the current RPC client may use persistent paths if is true.
member.returns: Null if is null, or there is no persistent root configuration, or the path cannot be expressed with it, or if is true and the caller cannot use persistent roots. Otherwise, normalized persistent vsls path with / slashes and without trailing /, e.g. /~~/c$/workspace/foo/bar.cs

member.summary: Try converting to/from persistent form.
member.param: Workspace file id to convert. May be null.
A value indicating whether persistent root form should be used if it's possible and allowed.
Whether to check caller permissions if is true.
member.returns: The argument if it's already in the right format and that format is allowed. New converted workspace file id if is not null and can be converted. If is true, and cannot be expressed in persistent root form, it's returned as non-persistent form. Otherwise, null.

Persistent root paths /~~/... are preferred to regular root paths /~0/.. if persistent root configuration is set, shared workspace path can be expressed with it, and the client can use it. If persistent root path is not used, full root path (/~x/) is used instead.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.LocalCascadeClient

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.NetworkUtility.VirtualNames
member.summary: List of substrings possibly found in a network interface name or description, which indicate the the interface is virtual and should be skipped.
member.remarks:
This list does not need to be completely exhaustive; it's mostly an optimization. If a virtual IP address is returned and a client tries to connect to that address (and Cascade port), the attempted connection will quickly fail and the client will move on to the next IP address or to the relay.
Note VPN interfaces MUST NOT be skipped, but those don't seem to have the word "virtual" in their name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Program.DisplayNetworkInfo
member.summary: Displays information about network interfaces and IP addresses that may be useful for diagnosing direct peer-to-peer connectivity issues with Cascade sessions.

member.summary: Server for accepting JSON-RPC sessions via a signalR relay hub

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.RelayStream
member.summary: Wraps a HybridConnectionStream to assist with performing a clean shutdown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.RelayStream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes the stream.
member.remarks: A relay stream must not be disposed concurrently with a read operation -- the HybridConnectionStream Shutdown() method throws an exception in that case. The finalRequest parameter to IRpcStream.SendRequestAsync can be used to ensure the RPC session stream is disposed at a point when there are no pending read operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.BrokerAuthorizationService
member.summary: Implementation of the broker authorization service.
member.remarks: The service is added into every local RPC session so that any broker process connected to the agent will be able to authorize itself given a valid broker token. The service injects an RPC relay for each permitted service name bridging the current client RPC session with target workspace remote sessions. Once authorized for the first time it's not possible to re-authorize the broker with a different token.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.BrokerManager
member.summary: A container of the registered broker entries shared across client and broker sessions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.BrokerManagerService
member.summary: Implementation of the broker manager service.
member.remarks: The service instance is created by the on every remote join operation so that it gets access to both host and guest RPC sessions. The service is disposed when the joined workspace is disposed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.SshRpcSessionFactory.DisableStreamTransport

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.SshStreamTransport
member.summary: Provides means for transporting stream over ssh session

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Streams.AsyncEncodingConverter
member.summary: Statefull encoding converter. Reading from it will read from the underlying reader and convert fromEncoding -> toEncoding. One call to ReadAsync can only result in atmost one call to ReadAsync on the underlying reader. Writing to it will convert toEncoding -> fromEncoding and write to the underlying writer. One call to WriteAsync may result to multiple calls on the underlying writer. Reading or writing is exclusive, meaning that only one consumer can read or write at a time. Reading can happen in parallel with writing. Cancelling reading or writing may cause undetermined behavior of subsequent reading or writing. Disposing will dispose the underlying readerwriter.
member.remarks: We cannot use StreamReader/StreamWriter for encoding conversion because we need to guarantee that one read from the caller will translate to one read from the underlying reader, which is not a guarantee in StreamReader. Having multiple reads instead of one is bad - the read from terminal is waiting on user input, and if we start waiting more than necessary, the already available input wouldn't be property processed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Streams.IStreamProvider
member.summary: Extensions that provide a stream returned by the

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateResult
member.summary: Result item from listing public certificates.
member.remarks: This class is designed to be compatible with the JSON Web Key (JWK) specification: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-jose-json-web-key-41 .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateResult.Issuer
member.summary: Gets or sets the issuer for which this certificate is used to sign tokens.
member.remarks: This value is omitted when certificates are requested for a single specific issuer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateResult.KeyType
member.summary: Gets or sets the key type. This is always "RSA" for certificates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateResult.KeyId
member.summary: Gets or sets the key ID. This is often, but not necessarily, the same as the thumbprint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateResult.Thumbprint
member.summary: Gets or sets the certificate thumbprint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateResult.PublicCertificate
member.summary: Gets or sets the base64-encoded public certificate bytes.
member.remarks: This is an array to accommodate a certificate chain. The first item in the array is the certificate for token validation; the others can be used to verify the first.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateResult.Modulus
member.summary: Gets or sets the RSA key modulus, in Base64urlUInt encoding.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateResult.Exponent
member.summary: Gets or sets the RSA key exponent, in Base64urlUInt encoding.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateResult.IsPrimary
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is the primary certificate for the issuer.
member.remarks: The primary certificate corresponds to the private certificate currently used to sign tokens for this issuer. Non-primary certificates may have been primary in the past or may become primary in the future, so validators should also consider them when validating tokens from the issuer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateSetResult
member.summary: Result from listing public certificates.
member.remarks: This class is designed to be compatible with the JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) specification: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-jose-json-web-key-41 .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.CertificateSetResult.Certificates
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of certificates.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.Tokens.JwtReader
member.summary: Similar to the `JwtReader` class from the VSSaaS-SDK, but highly simplified. Compared to that one, this class does not include support for tenant-specific issuers, encrypted tokens, audience validation, or decoding without validating. Also it uses `TraceSource` instead of `IDiagnosticsLogger`.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceConnector.DirectConnectTimeout
member.summary: Time spent trying to connect directly before trying the next connection option. This should be long enough to establish a connection on the same local network, but short enough not to cause an unreasonable delay when the connection fails.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceConnector.HandshakeTimeout
member.summary: Time spent waiting for the initial packet exchange after connecting, before trying the next connection option. (VPN gateways may sometimes "accept" TCP connections without actually enabling communication.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceIdGenerator.GenerateId(System.String[],System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a predictable/repeatable ID for a workspace.
member.remarks: The ID is a hash of the following parameters: - System ID (MAC address of the first non-loopback network interface) - User ID (from USERNAME environment variable) - Workspace root directory path(s) (case-insensitive) The hash is formatted as uppercase hex chars, truncated to a length of 20.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceService
member.summary: Implements the agent workspace service for listing, sharing, and joining workspaces.
member.remarks: The workspace service is never proxied to a remote agent. When joining a remote workspace, the join requst goes to the local agent first, and then the local agent creates an RPC session to the remote agent and sets up proxes for the OTHER services.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceService.LocalJoinNotSupported
member.summary: TODO: remove this once we fully support the local join workspace

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceService.SetWorkspaceReadyForConnectionAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Set shared workspace as ready for connection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceService.RegisterServicesAsync(System.String[],Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.CollectionChangeType,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Registers or unregisters service proxies that enable the client to provide RPC services to other clients in the workspace.
member.remarks: The RPC routing mechanism is built around a SharedWorkspace instance (one per workspace) that exists in the owners agent process for as long as the workspace is shared. That instance has an RpcServiceMap that tracks all services currently available in the workspace, indexed by service name. The values in the map are either actual service instances (for services like the file service that are provided by the owner agent) or service proxies that relay to the client that provides the service. (For non-owner clients, there is an additional proxy hop through the other agent.) The ServiceMap raises a ServicesChanged event when its contents change, and the change notification gets propagated to other agents and clients, informing them to update their proxies for the changed services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceService.RegisterWorkspaceServices(Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.SharedWorkspace)
member.summary: Called when sharing or joining a workspace. Register the workspace's available services with the client session, and notifies the client of their availability.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceService.OnRemoteWorkspaceServicesChanged(System.Object,Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.WorkspaceServicesChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Called when a joiner is notified that some workspace services have changed. Updates proxies to maintain routing of messages to/from changed services, and forwards the notification to the client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceService.AddRemoteWorkspaceServiceRelay(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a service relay for the added remote service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceService.OnWorkspaceServicesChanged(System.Object,Microsoft.Cascade.Rpc.ServicesChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Notifies each client session in the sharer's agent process about any changes to available workspace services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Agent.WorkspaceUserService.GetGuestUserProfileAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Takes a guest user token and either validates it directly and extracts the profile from claims, or sends it to the Cascade services to obtain the profile of the person who's represented by the user token.
This method can throw a RemoteException or an Exception if the operation fails.
member.param: The user token as received from the remote user
member.returns: A WorkspaceUserProfile with the information of the remote user

member.summary: Attempts to validate a guest session token and build a profile from token claims.
member.returns: Guest user profile, or null if not enough information was available to validate or build a profile directly. In that case, the profile might be obtained by calling the service.
member.exception: The token is definitely invalid for some reason described in the exception message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.KeychainFile
member.summary: Reads and writes credentials from/to a simple JSON file.
member.remarks:
This implementation does not apply any special access controls to the file, but it does preserve any controls that may be already in place. So for a little more security, a user could create an empty file ahead of time and apply access controls that limit access to the single user.
Still, this is inherently less secure than the default platform-specific keychain implementations, therefore it should only be used in environments where the default is not functional.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.NativeMethods.SetConsoleCtrlHandler(Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.NativeMethods.HandlerRoutine,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds or removes an application-defined HandlerRoutine function from the list of handler functions for the calling process.
member.param: A pointer to the application-defined HandlerRoutine function to be added or removed. This parameter can be NULL.
If this parameter is TRUE, the handler is added; if it is FALSE, the handler is removed.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.NativeMethods.HandlerRoutine
member.summary: An application-defined function used with the SetConsoleCtrlHandler function. A console process uses this function to handle control signals received by the process. When the signal is received, the system creates a new thread in the process to execute the function.
member.param: The type of control signal received by the handler.
member.returns: If the function handles the control signal, it should return TRUE. If it returns FALSE, the next handler function in the list of handlers for this process is used.
member.remarks: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/console/handlerroutine

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.NativeMethods.CtrlTypes
member.summary: The type of control signal received by the handler.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.NativeMethods.CtrlTypes.CTRL_C_EVENT
member.summary: A CTRL+C signal was received, either from keyboard input or from a signal generated by the GenerateConsoleCtrlEvent function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.NativeMethods.CtrlTypes.CTRL_BREAK_EVENT
member.summary: A CTRL+BREAK signal was received, either from keyboard input or from a signal generated by GenerateConsoleCtrlEvent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.NativeMethods.CtrlTypes.CTRL_CLOSE_EVENT
member.summary: A signal that the system sends to all processes attached to a console when the user closes the console (either by clicking Close on the console window's window menu, or by clicking the End Task button command from Task Manager).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.NativeMethods.CtrlTypes.CTRL_LOGOFF_EVENT
member.summary: A signal that the system sends to all console processes when a user is logging off. This signal does not indicate which user is logging off, so no assumptions can be made.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.NativeMethods.CtrlTypes.CTRL_SHUTDOWN_EVENT
member.summary: A signal that the system sends when the system is shutting down. Interactive applications are not present by the time the system sends this signal, therefore it can be received only be services in this situation. Services also have their own notification mechanism for shutdown events. For more information, see Handler.

member.summary: Initializes the specified startup info struct with the required properties and updates its thread attribute list with the specified ConPTY handle.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.NativeMethods.ClosePseudoConsole(System.IntPtr)
member.remarks: See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/console/closepseudoconsole

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.SafeKernelHandle.InitialSetHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Use this method with the default constructor to allow the memory allocation for the handle to happen before the CER call to get it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.WinptyNativeInterop.WINPTY_FLAG_CONERR
member.summary: Create a new screen buffer(connected to the "conerr" terminal pipe) and pass it to child processes as the STDERR handle.This flag also prevents the agent from reopening CONOUT$ when it polls -- regardless of whether the active screen buffer changes, winpty continues to monitor the original primary screen buffer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.WinptyNativeInterop.WINPTY_FLAG_PLAIN_OUTPUT
member.summary: Don't output escape sequences.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.WinptyNativeInterop.WINPTY_FLAG_COLOR_ESCAPES
member.summary: Do output color escape sequences. These escapes are output by default, but are suppressed with WINPTY_FLAG_PLAIN_OUTPUT. Use this flag to reenable them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.WinptyNativeInterop.WINPTY_FLAG_ALLOW_CURPROC_DESKTOP_CREATION
member.summary: On XP and Vista, winpty needs to put the hidden console on a desktop in a service window station so that its polling does not interfere with other (visible) console windows. To create this desktop, it must change the process' window station (i.e. SetProcessWindowStation) for the duration of the winpty_open call. In theory, this change could interfere with the winpty client (e.g. other threads, spawning children), so winpty by default spawns a special agent process to create the hidden desktop. Spawning processes on Windows is slow, though, so if WINPTY_FLAG_ALLOW_CURPROC_DESKTOP_CREATION is set, winpty changes this process' window station instead. See https://github.com/rprichard/winpty/issues/58.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.WinptyNativeInterop.WINPTY_MOUSE_MODE_NONE
member.summary: QuickEdit mode is initially disabled, and the agent does not send mouse mode sequences to the terminal. If it receives mouse input, though, it still writes MOUSE_EVENT_RECORD values into CONIN.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.WinptyNativeInterop.WINPTY_MOUSE_MODE_AUTO
member.summary:
QuickEdit mode is initially enabled. As CONIN enters or leaves mouse input mode (i.e. where ENABLE_MOUSE_INPUT is on and ENABLE_QUICK_EDIT_MODE is off), the agent enables or disables mouse input on the terminal.
This is the default mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.WinptyNativeInterop.WINPTY_MOUSE_MODE_FORCE
member.summary: QuickEdit mode is initially disabled, and the agent enables the terminal's mouse input mode. It does not disable terminal mouse mode (until exit).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.WinptyNativeInterop.WINPTY_SPAWN_FLAG_AUTO_SHUTDOWN
member.summary: If the spawn is marked "auto-shutdown", then the agent shuts down console output once the process exits. The agent stops polling for new console output, and once all pending data has been written to the output pipe, the agent closes the pipe. (At that point, the pipe may still have data in it, which the client may read. Once all the data has been read, further reads return EOF.)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.WinptyNativeInterop.WINPTY_SPAWN_FLAG_EXIT_AFTER_SHUTDOWN
member.summary:
After the agent shuts down output, and after all output has been written into the pipe(s), exit the agent by closing the console. If there any surviving processes still attached to the console, they are killed.
Note: With this flag, an RPC call (e.g. winpty_set_size) issued after the agent exits will fail with an I/O or dead-agent error.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Platforms.Windows.WinptyNativeInterop.WINPTY_SPAWN_FLAG_MASK
member.summary: All the spawn flags.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ErrorDetails.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets the error message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ErrorDetails.StackTrace
member.summary: Gets or sets the error stack trace.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ExchangeParameters
member.summary: Request parameters for exchanging a token.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ExchangeParameters.Token
member.summary: Gets or sets the token to be exchanged, if that token was not specified in the `Authorization` request header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ExchangeParameters.Provider
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the token provider, if a was specified in the body.
member.remarks: Required if the property is specified. Must be one of the values from .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ExchangeParameters.Client
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client that the token was issued to.
member.remarks:
Recommended if the is . Must be one of the values from .
The token will be considered invalid if it was not issued to the specified client.
If unspecified, the token is validated against multiple clients, which may be slower.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ExchangeParameters.Audience
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional requested audience for the resulting token.
member.remarks: If unspecified, the configured default audience will be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ExchangeParameters.Lifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional requested lifetime for the resulting token.
member.remarks: If the requested lifetime is greater than the configured maximum, the maximum is used. If unspecified, the configured default lifetime will be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ExchangeParameters.Scopes
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional requested scopes for the resulting token.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.IssueResult
member.summary: Result from issuing or exchanging a token.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.IssueResult.Token
member.summary: Gets or sets the issued token.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ProblemDetails
member.summary: Structure of error details returned by the token service, including validation errors.
member.remarks:
This object may be returned with a response status code of 400 (or other 4xx code).
Compatible with RFC 7807 Problem Details (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807) and https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.aspnetcore.mvc.problemdetails but doesn't require adding a dependency on that package.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ProblemDetails.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the error title.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ProblemDetails.Detail
member.summary: Gets or sets the error detail.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ProblemDetails.Errors
member.summary: Gets or sets additional details about individual request properties.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ProviderNames
member.summary: Names identity providers known to the token service, for which token-exchange is supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ProviderNames.Microsoft
member.summary: Microsoft (AAD/MSA) identity provider.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ProviderNames.AAD
member.summary: Alternate Microsoft (AAD/MSA) identity provider.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ProviderNames.GitHub
member.summary: GitHub identity provider.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.TokenServiceClient
member.summary: Client for token service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.TokenServiceClient.DefaultExchangeTokenLifetime
member.summary: The default lifetime value for the Cascade-exchanged authentication token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.TokenServiceClient.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an HTTP client and no client authentication callback.
member.param: HttpClient with base address set to the token service (not including any API path).
member.remarks: Only some of the token service APIs can be called with no authentication.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.TokenServiceClient.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue}})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an HTTP client and a client authentication callback.
member.param: HttpClient with base address set to the token service (not including any API path).
Async callback for retrieving a client auth token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.TokenServiceClient.ConvertResponseAsync``1(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Converts a token service HTTP response to a result object (or exception).
member.param: Response from a token service request.
True if 404 Not Found is a valid response.
member.returns: Result object of the requested type, or null if the response is Not Found and is true.
member.exception: The service returned a 400 Bad Request response.
The service return a 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden response.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.TokenServiceClient.ExchangeAsync(Microsoft.Cascade.Tokens.ExchangeParameters,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Exchanges a token for a newly issued JWT token via the token service.
member.param: Input token and parameters for the exchange.
member.returns: The issued JWT token.
member.exception: Some claims or parameters were missing or invalid. The exception message often contains details.
The client authentication token was missing or invalid.
